name: Wolstenholme's theorem
rephrased: For any prime number p that is 5 or larger, the binomial coefficient C(2p-2, p-1) is divisible by p squared.
implication_form: If p is a prime number greater than or equal to 5, then C(2p-2, p-1) ≡ 1 (mod p²).
solved_by: Unsolved (the forward direction was proven, but the converse is not generally established)
explained: Wolstenholme's theorem is a proven result in number theory, not a conjecture. It states that for any prime number p ≥ 5, the binomial coefficient C(2p-1, p-1) (read as '2p-1 choose p-1) satisfies the congruence C(2p-1, p-1) ≡ 1 (mod p²).
related_conjectures: Congruences for binomial coefficients modulo primes
